meanings.definition: A formal dance, especially one held for a high school or college class at the end of the academic year.
meanings.sent1: The proms at our school are always full of music and dancing.
meanings.sent2: She looked forward to the proms all year, excited to dress up and have fun with her friends.
meanings.sent3: The proms turned the gym into a magical ballroom for the night.
meanings.sent4: The proms transformed the students into elegant princes and princesses.
meanings.sent5: The proms sparkled with laughter and joy, creating unforgettable memories for everyone.

meanings.definition: A series of concerts, typically of classical music, held in the summer.
meanings.sent1: The proms in the park feature beautiful orchestral performances under the stars.
meanings.sent2: Attending the proms is a summer tradition for music lovers in the city.
meanings.sent3: The proms brought a touch of sophistication to the summer festival.
meanings.sent4: The proms filled the air with harmonious melodies that enchanted the audience.
meanings.sent5: The proms showcased the talent of world-class musicians, drawing crowds from far and wide.
